topic.shortdesc: Little Red Riding Hood Goes is Sent off to her Grandma

section.title: Her Little Red Hood
section.p: One fateful night, in the thee barren lands of Archasia, a woman lay creaming in agony on her soggy, wooden floor. The woman cried for her husband, who had been placing melted snow-water on a dirty rag to keep her in comfort. An old woman stood at the by the laboring woman, taking the rag and pressing it on her head.

The Hoode Family hadn't expected this. Years of malnutrition as poor farmers had dwindled their birth rates for decades. Ma was an only child whose 3 aunts and uncles total, all died before they reached the age of three. She only had one daughter, Lyeeda. Lyeeda got so sick as a child, the witchdoctor said she "couldn't borne any chiren."So all were shocked when,10 years after getting married, Lyeeda became pregnant.

"Babe's comin Reid, bring the cloth!" Ma shouted as Lyeeda pushed one final time. As she did, the snow out the window began to clear up, every creak in the hose became painfully noticeable. The stars had appeared in the sky, and even from their dilapedated window, they seemed to glare at the family with the burning of a thousand sun gods. Lyeeda sighed, Reid, sat heavily, Ma grabbed a big red handkerchief from her breast-pocket and wrapped the baby in it. The child was born(her name will be Ryda)

There once was a baby, born in a house, so small and so quaint, they could house a mouse. When baby was born, her cheeks were like rose, blooming and peaking, from under her nose. Her mother was shocked, her papa was glad, and Granny kept laughing, they thought she went mad. But then Granny smiled, and laid down some wood, "I'm gonna make her, a little red hood.
And that Granny did, with labor and heart, her little red hood, was one piece of art. She placed it on baby, and all things were good, and that's how we got, little red riding hood

section.title: Preparing her Goods
section.p: Little Red Riding Hood was noble and true, she did love her family, and probably loves you! Her mom sent her off with a basket of goods, "Your Grandma is sick, your Grandma is ill, so please run and give her, this basket of food
